summary: Alaska is the biggest state in the U.S. by area, located at the far northwest of North America. It's not connected to the rest of the U.S., with Canada to its east and Russia to its west across the Bering Strait. Alaska has a small population but is rich in natural resources like oil and gas, making it one of the wealthiest states per person. It was first colonized by Russia but became a U.S. territory in 1867 and a state in 1959. Its capital is Juneau, and the most populous city is Anchorage.
title: Alaska
